lines.text: I'm black and I'm proud.
What do you play?
I used to play football in school.
I mean, what instrument?
I don't.
What are you doing here, then?
Well, I saw everyone else lining up, so, uh - I thought you were selling drugs.
What do you call yourselves?
"And And And."
"And And fuckin' And?"
Well, Ray's thinking of putting an exclamation mark after the second "and." Says it'd look deadly on the posters.
Psshh...
You don't like it? You think it should go at the end?
I think it should go up his arse.
Well, we're not married to it.
What did Evel Knievel want?
God sent him.
What?
God sent him.
On a fucking Suzuki?
[learning the band will be called "The Commitments"]
The Commitments?
It's a "the".
How do you spell it?
T-H-E.
Look, I know you're hurtin' now, but in time you'll realize what you've achieved.
I've achieved nothing!

You're missin' the point. The success of the band was irrelevant - you raised their expectations of life, you lifted their horizons. Sure we could have been famous and made albums and stuff, but that would have been predictable. This way it's poetry.

[pretending to be Terry Wogan]
So, lookin' back Jimmy, what have you learned from your experience with The Commitments?
Well, that's a tricky question, Terry. But as I always say, we skipped the light fandango, turned cartweels 'cross the floor. I was feelin' kinda seasick, but the crowd called out for more.

[pretending to be Terry Wogan]
That's very profound Jimmy! What does it mean?
I'm fucked if I know,Terry!
I got Mickah Wallace to do Security.
Mickah Wallace? But he's a savage!
Yeah... but he's OUR savage!
[in the confessional]
And there's these three girls with the band, I've had lustful thoughts about all of them.
I'm black and I'm proud.

Soul is the music people understand. Sure it's basic and it's simple. But it's something else 'cause, 'cause, 'cause it's honest, that's it. Its honest. There's no fuckin' bullshit. It sticks its neck out and says it straight from the heart. Sure there's a lot of different music you can get off on but soul is more than that. It takes you somewhere else. It grabs you by the balls and lifts you above the shite.
say it once and say it loud, I'm black and I'm proud.
[Jimmy has been auditioning unimpressive musicians all day]

[singing]
I was happy in the haze of a drunken hour, but heaven knows I'm miserable now...
Yeah, I know how you feel.
Who're you, then?
Are you the one startin the band?
Yeah.
The name's Joseph Fagin. Joey "The Lips" Fagin.

[sarcastically]
And I'm Jimmy "The Bollocks" Rabbitte
I get mine from my horn playing. How'd you get yours?
Don't get snotty with me.
I get snotty with no man.

[in confessional]
Used to, when I studied I would sing hymns, but now all I can sing is "When A Man Loves A Woman" by Marvin Gaye
Percy Sledge.
What?
It was Percy Sledge did that particular song. I have the album.
Oh...
If I'm gonna front the band, I like the sound of "Deco."
Deco the bus conductor. Is that "top-Deco" or "bottom-Deco"?
Is this the band then? Betcha U2 are shittin' themselves.
That's fuckin' blasphemy. Elvis wasn't a Cajun.
Elvis is not soul.

[defensively]
Elvis is God.
I never pictured God with a fat gut and corset singing "My Way" at Caesar's Palace.
Fuck. Fuck. Fuck.
That's three Hail Marys for you tomorrow.
He eats like a pig.
He's such a prick.
Hasn't got the voice of a pig though. Joey says it belongs to God.
God should ask for it back.
You all right, Jimmy?
Sure. They just get on my arse at times.
Wanna share a taxi home?
For fuck's sake, Natalie. How could you ask me that after what I just said in there?
Well if you weren't the manager, would you?
Would I what?
...take me home?
But I am the manager.

I'd like to introduce you to the hardest-workin' band in the world. On bass, Derek "Meatman" Scully. On piano, Steven "Soul Surgeon" Clifford. Dean "Mr Nipple" Fay on sax. Joey "The Lips" Fagan on trumpet. Our gorgeous chanteuses are Bernie, Imelda, and Natalie. Deco "Deep Throat" Cuffe on vocals. On lead guitar, Outspan "Fender bender" Foster. Finally, on drums, Mickah "Don't Fuck With Me" Wallace. Ladies and gentlemen, The Commitments.
What do you think, Jimmy, they'll be eatin' chips out of our knickers?
And you... George Michael... you ever call me a fuckin' eejit again, you'll go home with the drumsticks stuck up your hole... the one you don't sing out of.
That'll be the day.
I'm tellin' ya it's coming, so keep your Vaseline handy.
[Joey and Dean are rehearsing apart from the rest of the band]
Are you doing what I told you? Are you thinking of that reed as a woman's nipple?
Are you doing what I said? Are you thinking of that reed as a woman's nipple?
I am. But, I'm a little embarrassed, she's still in school.
Maybe you should set your sights a little higher? My trumpet was always Gina Lollobrigida.

[thinking]
How about Kim Basinger?

[holds his hand up to his chest as though cupping a breast]
Is she?
Oh, yeah!
Right. Pick a nipple and try again.
Mr. Rabbitte, you've been collecting unemployment benefit for two years. Are you trying to tell me you can't get a job?
We're a third world country - what can you do?
[the band opens the "window" of the chippie van]
Excuse me, would you have any Rock Salmon?
No, I'm sorry - we only have "Soul"!
[talking about kicking Ray out of the band]
How did Ray take the news?
Not too bad. Said he was goin' solo.
He doesn't have much of a choice, does he?
There's a band around called "Free Beer". Always draws a big crowd.
I like "A Flock of Budgies".
We have to be "the" something. All the great sixties bands were "The Somethings".
We could be... The Northsiders.
Or The Liffy Lads.
How about... The Fucking Eejits?

[watching video of James Brown performing]
Do y'not think, uh - we're a little white for that sort of thing?

[Bernie, Imelda and Natalie are rehearsing for their solo]
If they're singing, then what am I supposed to do?
You can sing along, you've bigger tits than all of them.
What's that? A Mister Chippy van?
We can't travel in that shit heap.
Buddy Holly's last words.
What?
We can't travel in that shit heap.
Did Buddy Holly say that?
Before he flew to meet his destiny on that storm-tossed night.
Will crashin' in a chipper van make us famous, huh?
I've a bugle here you can blow on.
I've an arse here you can kiss.
